titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bound for Glory records, 1969-2015.
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Phillip Shapiro

publicationstmt.publisher: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Evan Earle, September 2017

Guide to the Bound For Glory Records

did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Audio recordings of the radio shows featuring a wide range of folk performers. Reels include inserts with handwritten notes by Shapiro about the performances and a list of the songs played. The notes and lists may have spelling errors and song titles may have been generated from how the song sounded not the actual title. Some notes also include markings to indicate songs that were particularly notable.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Bound for Glory is North America's longest running live folk concert radio broadcast. The show is broadcast live on WVBR 93.5 FM from Anabel Taylor Hall on the Cornell University campus Sunday nights. While the name of the room where the show is broadcast has changed over the years, the Commons Coffeehouse, Cul de Snack, the Cafe at Anabel Taylor, Alternatives Library, the space itself in Anabel Taylor has remained constant. Phil Shapiro made his first Ithaca broadcast of the show in September 1967 on the WVBR radio station. Bound for Glory presents folk music of all types and has run for over 1,500 concerts.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to the history of the Bound for Glory folk music show. Audio recordings of the Bound for Glory radio shows featuring a wide range of folk performers. Reels include inserts with handwritten notes by Shapiro about the performances and a list of the songs played. The notes and lists may have spelling errors and song titles may have been generated from how the song sounded not the actual title. Some notes also include markings to indicate songs that were particularly notable.
Also digital recordings created by Doug Steinfeld off tapes collected by himself, Sari Goldbaum, and Janet Elis. These items are identified as part of the Doug Steinfeld collection.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS

userestrict.p: Audio reels TR-15957 through TR-15976 have been digitized as well as the track listing inserts in each of these reel cases.

Due to the fragility and potential degradation of moving image and sound recordings, viewing and listening is limited to items that have been digitized. If an item is in another media format, you may request to have the item digitized for access. Information on ordering access copies may be found on the Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections webpage.

descgrp.p: A portion of these recordings come from the collection of Doug Steinfeld. These tapes were digitized by Steinfeld who remains in possession of the physical tapes. Some of these recordings have a break from the initial recording when the tape was flipped over during set two of the performance. The Steinfeld collection also contains a set of Encore tapes. These tapes contain encores for shows that were not necessarily included on the on air broadcast or on the show tape.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Bound for Glory records, #35-9-4277. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: The Bound for Glory Documentary is available online here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iF3N2xA5RB8

did.unittitle: Bound for Glory The Documentary by Brad Kolodner (digital)

scopecontent.p: Short documentary by Brad Kolodner and Aya Hoffman when they were Ithaca College seniors. "This is a story about the passion and love one man has for folk music and the sacrifices he's made to keep this folk treasure alive."

did.unittitle: Bound for Glory 1500th Show Phil Shapiro Tribute Book (digital)

scopecontent.p: CD-2668 a digital copy of the book.
